channel.title: CTFs on Imtodess
channel.description: Recent content in CTFs on Imtodess

item.title: THM | Hackpark | Walkthrough (No Metasploit)
item.description: Exploitation Guide For Hackpark Summary In this walkthrough we will brute-force the login, and exploit the blogging platform with publicly available exploit. Then we will escalate our privileges by exploiting one of the services running on the target machine which has insecure file permissions. Enumeration Service Enumeration using Nmap â”Œâ”€â”€(kaliã‰¿kali)-[~/ctf/thm/hackpark/scans] â””â”€$ nmap $ip -p- -Pn -vv PORT STATE SERVICE REASON 80/tcp open http syn-ack 3389/tcp open ms-wbt-server syn-ack â”Œâ”€â”€(kaliã‰¿kali)-[~/ctf/thm/hackpark/scans] â””â”€$ nmap -Pn -p80,3389 -sVCT -oN nmapInitial.

item.title: THM | Alfred | Walkthrough
item.description: Exploitation Guide For Alfred Summary In this room, we’ll learn how to exploit a common misconfiguration on a widely used automation server(Jenkins - This tool is used to create continuous integration/continuous development pipelines that allow developers to automatically deploy their code once they made change to it). After which, we’ll use an interesting privilege escalation method to get full system access. Enumeration Service Enumeration using Nmap First we will do a quick scan to see which services are running on the target machine.

item.title: HTB | Ophiuchi | Walkthrough
item.description: Exploitation Guide forÂ Ophiuchi Summary: In this box, we will be exploiting yaml parsing (deserialization) vulnerability to get RCEÂ . Then exploit the misconfigured sudo privilege to gain the root shell. Enumeration Nmap â”Œâ”€â”€(rootðŸ’€kali)-[/home/â€¦/ctf/htb/ophiuchi/scans] â””â”€# nmap -sS -sV -T4 -p- -A 10.10.10.227 -oN nmap_full_syn.txt Starting Nmap 7.91 ( <https://nmap.org> ) at 2021-06-04 22:09 EDT Stats: 0:11:21 elapsed; 0 hosts completed (1 up), 1 undergoing SYN Stealth Scan SYN Stealth Scan Timing: About 60.
